comment:
Adriene! I can't thank you enough. This practice was very emotional for me today (I truly connected). I've been out of shape for a while. And for the last two years I've been suffering from regular panic attacks and anxiety. I didn't feel good in my body or my head. And after thinking about it for years, I finally decided to start yoga. You're the only instructor that was able to inspire me, that I was able to connect with. You made me feel like I could do it. I was terrified to start the challenge, but look at me, just finished day 28!!! I already feel stronger and I have more energy. Some days I don't even have anxiety, which is amazing. Thank you for all you are doing, you ARE making a difference in people's lives. Thank you, thank you, thank you. Much love to you, my friend. <3
The sun is out today (after a storm), hallelujah.
Great morning! Happy 2022 Adriene!
Thank you Adriene
I thought I couldn’t twist my dog….and then I just did!!! And I was so surprised that I almost fell
2 to go!👍🏼
I CANNOT believe that I made it this far! I’m about to do Day 28 today. I feel like I’m officially a yogi! 🧘🏾‍♀️
Crazy to think but I started this practice early today because I was sad and crying, and I just felt that Ietting it all out on the mat would help. It worked! Feeling much better now. Thank you 🙏
2 to go then let’s keep going 😜 there are tons of videos to be made.

Day 28! I took some days off this list because I was in vacation with some friends and no internet, but I kept doing yoga by myself, no videos. Today I did this one and I really loved those flip dogs, never tried them, but felt awesome, what a great stretch! I'll be adding them into my practices, because they were a little tough for me. Namaste!!!
Day 28 completed! 2 more days left.YAY
I was so sore from surfing yesterday. But after completing this session I feel awesome 😎 thank you Adrienne
Day 538 in books ❤️😀
Adriene! Thank you. i love the way you teach. You came into my life at the right moment. thanks for making a difference in my life.
I did it!! I had already convinced myself that I wouldn't be able to flip my body around. But I did it!
My 28th birthday just happened to land on day 28! What a wonderful day to connect to my inner child.
Day 28 ✅
I feel transformed Adriene, thank you so so much!
I had fun with this!! Which videos of yours teaches how to do foundation or start learning yoga poses hand stands etc?

I had a lot of anger in me today. I went for a walk and then, after lunch, decided to do day 28. I packed crow and lizard poses at the end, and I'm so much calmer now.
it was okay to be angry, and now it's okay to let it go.
namaste
I have really bad period cramps today but this session relieves the pain to a more tolerable level. Thank you so much Adriene
thank you!!!!!
Awesome!  So proud that I made it this far!
Thank you
Hi Adrienne, I thought of doing Kore advancements sticking to all basics. I will WILL tho, wish to get silly with you later alone the, Namaste💙💓
I loved today’s practice! I can’t believe there’s only two days left! Thank you for everything, Adriene🥰❤️

This one was challenging for me I was sweating like a pig lol but it was so so fun, I don't understand I've hated sports for my whole life but with yoga, everything is so fun and it feels so good. Thank you, Adriene. Thanks to you I get to experience this. And I couldn't even stay in plank before but I did 10 push-ups today. I'm proud of myself and thankful to Adriene!
Guys!! My heels touched the ground in down dog! I repeat! MY HEELS TOUCHED THE GROUND!
Thank you so much! This was wonderful!
This practice was so perfect for helping me get out of my head and out of some depressing and anxious thoughts. :) Thank you as always Adrienne for curating such thoughtful tutorials
thanks, Adriene for another lesson. I'm excited to finish this challenge and start another one <3 all 2021 doing yoga with you :)
Great practice today Adriene.. 🙏 Namaste 🧘‍♀️
Yay!! So proud of myself for keeping it up to day 28. Today was the first day that practice felt short.

After 14 straight days I could bend forward and touch my toes. After 28 straight days, today my heels touched the ground in downward dog. Granted the posed was from from perfect, it still felt great. Thanks Adriene for all that you here.
After this 30 day journey I'll go back to fwfg and see where it takes me. Been a while since I took a Rey or Marnie class.

Adrienne: I am on day 28 and I’m so sad that I am almost done with my 30 day yoga challenge. I have been doing this every morning before starting my day and working long hours from home (of course virtually). I feel so much better, centered, stronger and headache free. Your clear direction, fun approach to yoga and calm presence have been an inspiration. I am a convert for sure. Please share more. Many thanks to you!
i loved when you talked about children doing downward facing dog poses because here in Brazil when they do these, people say that they're asking for a sibling, just a funny fact i thought I'd share

this was awesome!! i've finally figured out downward dog -- my heels sometimes even touch the mat! overall i have less pain, feel more strong, and am more centered and happy on the days I've spent doing this
That Martha Graham reference gave me LIFE! 💜

I have scoliosis and my hips are always out of line and makes me extremely self conscious about it. As I approached the end of our 30 day yoga journey I realized my hips are aligned and where they should be. Also I noticed a lot of the pain that comes with it is gone so. Thank you for sharing your practice and teaching with us all.
I have never done something these many days straight. Thank you Adrienne
Today was just beautiful! Thank you Adriene ;) Namaste
Thank you so much Adriene. Feeling much stronger today 💪
Day 28 done!
I was hoping to finish 30 days before Christmas, but it's Jan 1, 2021 and I just completed Day 28.  I can't believe there are only two more days to go.

I fell down the stairs (as you do :P) - all good, just bashed my shin and got some nice swelling and a hand-size bruise - so that cut me out for five days, but I've been doing two sessions a day to catch up and I think I'm gonna make it! Thanks Adriene :))
Merry Christmas everyone!  Today’s practice and yoga with Adrienne in general, is by far the best gift !  Thank you Adrienne and all of our friends who show up!❤️❤️🎄

I like your videos. Doing yoga as a beginner. But only 1 critic I have. Is when you are explaining a move while in downward facing dog. It can be too long. I'm over here shaking in tiredness wishing youd be quicker. I cant really hold positions which use my arms for long. My muscles are screaming for you to hurry up. Lol
I did day 28
In love with this routine! Thank you, Adriene! Was able to do the flip dog pose. And for that, I realized I need to be more grateful for my body and for the sun.   Namaste

Another great workout :) and a great sync with my body. 

While tough and will require practice, I hope to bring that sense of calm and caring and wonder to all areas of my life. 

Thank you all so much. Love you all! and namaste :)
Day 28: My heels touched the ground in downward dog. Out of nowhere, just like Adriene said they would :)

day 57 for me in the bank!  thank you Adriene!  i remain a total beginner after two rounds (almost) of 30 days, but so much stronger, flexible and looser.  which of your other offerings to you recommend next?  i need another multi-day program to follow!
So enjoyed this 🙌💖🙌
Thank you Adrienne for being awesomee
I believe I am finally, finally, finding what feels good for my body in my every day life. I tearfully (trust me, tears are in my eyes) thank you.
28 down, 2 to go...
I can't believe I haven't missed a day, I love you Adriene, thank you so much! Namaste
Day 28!!! I'm surprised and emotional at the same moment f
May have to repeat this one that dog flip totally flipped me out!
I can't believe I have done 28/30! Thank you!
Difficult pose  .but tried it as far as I could. Thank you. 2 days to go!

Day 1: 24.1 million views. 
Day 28: 1.3 million views.
IDK why so many have dropped out, this is the gentlest, most soothing practice I think I've ever done. Congrats on everyone who's made it this far!
Although my day was not so bright, I made it to the mat and I felt at peace for 20 mins, and it was much needed. namaste everyone.
When I flipped my dog I hooted and laughed out loud!! And then I cried a little because it was such a rush of release! I’m so happy I did this 30 days. I look forward to it at the end of my day.
This is my.first practice that I did right after waking up. I'm looking forward to feeling energized for the day 🤗

Day 28 -  I'm a husky girl. When I move into various folds & poses, there is a lot of distance between me and (enter body part). It's a still struggle at Day 28 but totally enjoyable! And literally, each time I jus wanna give up, Adriene makes a suggestion to bend the knees, take a rest, take a knee - always conscience of her community. Thank you Adriene - YOU are part of the TEAM of ME - you don't give up on me and I won't give up on me either! Namaste.

I was introduced to Yoga With Adriene during the Corona Virus shut down. It is amazing! I am almost 72 and am amazed by how my balance, flexibility & core strength is increasing! One is never too old for yoga. Also- I love Adriene's gentle sense of humor. She makes me smile every morning.

Today in the free play time I practiced the crow pose and I stood comfortably for like 7-8 seconds!! I can't believe it!!! The most I've done yet was like 1.5 secs and that even made me incredibly happy, but this!!!! I'm so proud and I LOVE YOGA!!!!! And I LOVE ADRIENE!!!!!!!!!
Thank you so much Adrienne, Such fun I luv it all and you have helped me so much in this lockdown. shall compliment you soon.  x

Well, the mat is our playground. 
Loved it.
omg please stop talking for 5 SECONDS at least
Love from Iceland
Haha! I did it! My arms are strong enough to do a reverse dog! 🎉💖🎉

I'm like the last person to even think about doing Yoga, but after months of University work at my desk being hunched over, mixed with quarantine rendering me stiff and inactive, I thought I should treat my body with this.  Hopefully throughout this journey some passersby will come across this comment as I intend to edit this comment daily for the 30 days to share my journey!  Full journey comment thread is on the Day 1 video:) [Day 28/30]
-
Day 28 - Wow that flipped Downward Dog was insane, but what's crazier is the fact that I even managed to pull it off!  Felt so good to do a difficult move.  Overall great video again, was great for my entire body and I loved how Adriene gave us a bit more freedom on how to transition into different positions.  It's a nice subtle way to show her build in trust in us over this 30 day journey and to remind us that it's always been us in control, not Adriene:)
Thank you :)
this is on Jonathan Pie's vlog playlist, does he like yoga?
Thank you Adriene for your gentle encouragement, I never feel defeated even if I can't quite reach or hold a posture
MY HEELS ARE TOUCHING THE FLOOR IN DOWNWARD DOG AAA
Hey!  How come I could do that front to back transition thing without falling over???  I'm pretty sure I couldn't have done it before.....maybe I'm getting STRONGER!!  Awesome!!
Oh boy am I the only one who has gotten to day 28 and can still barely do downward dog
Love this just finished day 28
Done
This is the first challenge which I am sure would be able to complete in 2 more days now! #adrienebesogood
All was well until 16 mins..Felt like an overdone pretzel discarded into the cut off pile.  You make everything look so majestic!

Dear Adriene , thank you for these amazing, daily yoga sessions. sometimes I feel I am in the same room with you and find myself answering or laughing with you. I am practising other sessions too to try and do 1 hour a day. I feel soo much stronger and am connecting with my body too. I am from Malta and was introduced to you by my 25 year old son. 
you're a star and thank you again.
I would like to ask you if you do yoga specifically;;y for knee pain? I've tried your back, hip and neck and many many more . 
what's great is that there are so many videos to choose from. 
a big well done from me .
Anna Paris

I absolutely love yoga. I started 28 days ago and I think I can do this forever... problem is, I have knee pains that started a week into the 30 days... I never put more strain than my knees could handle, I don't know what I'm doing wrong... I'm afraid if I do this long term I might create irreversible problems
I'm halfway thru my chemotherapy treatments and I've made it to day 28! Adriene made it so easy to follow and really inspired me to not give up. Thanks so much for all you do!
Day 28 .. no stopping now .. day 28 done ! .. great session again ..you are redefining and making yoga fun for me! ..than you Adriene 🙏

Woohoo ❣️💪❤️...I will keep going ahead 😊🙏 today is day 28; of my yoga journey with Adrienne ....
#DAY28 Completed 💪🏻💪💪💪💪🏻💪💪💪🙏🙏🙏🙏 Namaste 🙏🙏 from NEPAL 🇳🇵❣️🥰✔️

This was my favourite 'episode' so far!  Great message to keep it fun and lose the roboyogi feeling - lol.  Never thought of it like that.  Thank you Adriene! Your videos are just right and an easy yoga commitment.  I am wondering if there is anything I could do to strengthen my wrists. Esp. The right, I can barely hold a one hand pose.  I think I just have weak wrists and have always had wrist issues when doing yoga.  Thank you again!  Well done!!
I am really proud of myself for that, can't believe I only have 2 days left. What should I do next?

I had such a long night taking care of covid patients. My back was hurting and normally I would just sleep. Did this and instantly felt better! Thank you Adriene, cant thank you enough for the past 28 days

Hey! Kuddos to everyone who reached till day28! I just wanted to share my experience. For last three days I was getting headaches continuously, probably because of the Work from home scenario going on rn and looking at a screen for too much time but you won't believe every single day in the past three days my headache vanished away after the yoga session! 3 days continuously! Thanks Adriene! You're a 🌟!

Day 28 and I am still here and I guess I am going to finish this.  I read the comments am I the only one still frustrated....when she says 'take your time' and I can barely rush there in time.  When she says don't worry if you fall we will catch you and well I am worried cause it is a real possibily and no one will.  But on the other handling I guess the people struggling a lot with this already likely dropped out and I am determined to finish.  My flip the dog was a flop the dog and so many things I can't get anywhere close to what she is doing. But i can stack my knees yeah and I do for sure feel stronger and that I do want to kep doing yoga.  Not sure if with het. During I am a grumpy would.be yogi but after I feel good.  Oddly I think my singing voice has improved
Day 28 done!!!! #2020 two more days to go and we are done with this plan❤️❤️❤️

this was so much fun! and wow, such a moment for me. i have hypermobility syndrome, and my arms are particularly bendy so usually with any pressure they just sorta...collapse 🤣 i thought there would be no chance i’d manage the flip dog with my arms, but i decided to pause the video and just keep giving it a go. and do you know what? it was pretty much there! i think i need to work on rounding out just a tiny bit more, but the fact i was able to do it almost perfectly AND hold it is a huge huge thing for me as a bendy. thank you for boosting my confidence so much 🤍
I have a paranoid feeling that day 30 is going to be like that Spongebob episode where Sandy pushes him over the edge with extreme sports.
That flipped dog was a challenge for me today! I have very hyper-extending elbows and I couldn’t stay in it for long. But that’s cool! The body spoke and I listened 🤗
Still in quarantine. Still doing yoga every damn day. It's helped tremendously. thank you! anyone else in quarantine? where y'all from?
Enjoyed the looseness of this practice but found the pace a bit quick for me to make to most of the postures.

Still here.  I have done a yoga practice every day for over 30 days. A couple of days I just did my own routine. I feel really good physically and mentally and emotionally. I'm starting to think about my intention for the next 30 days which is to continue what we've started here. See you tomorrow. NAMASTE

I love that you explain the moves so I can understand them without having to turn and look at the screen. I've tried other instructors and always have to turn around and see what they're doing. Thanks for keeping it simple it makes me believe I can do it.

Today marks 4 weeks of daily yoga on day 28. Actually, I did a week of your beginners videos so it’s 5 weeks. I had a left L4 injury and my left back and hips were so stiff and weak in the beginning. I can’t believe how much strength and flexibility I have regained. Also how much pain has gone. Thank you! I shall forever keep this habit. So often people think of health as a prescription or surgery (and I am a medical doctor, my career was built on this belief), but the real healing comes from daily commitment and the will to change, my body followed. 🙏
One of my cats has now gotten in the habit of doing yoga with me....and gets very vocal if I don’t get started when he’s ready for me to start😂 Thanks again for a wonderful session!
You talk to much....😒
I can’t believe I’m almost done 30 days! It’s really helping me with quarantine!
Did not feel like doing this today. Did it, loved it, feel amazing for it. Thank you

i can' t believe that i made it to day 28. sounds weird for me to stick with something that nobody imposed me to do and is not necessary to survive. yoga is slowly making me organize my life better and stick to my goals!
Flip dog is the first big transition pose I've ever successfully done, and while I know it isn't all that difficult, it still made me excited!!
I've really been enjoying this challenge! I don't ever think I've stuck with one of these challenges for as long. If you see this Rachel keep it up, and I'm glad I joined you on this journey!
Day 29- Was feeling really lethargic today... but got it done!
Day 28 Done! Yay! Playful with healthy mind and body ❤️ Thank you Adriene!
Nice
Adriene, Thank you! #Day28 ! playful at heart, stronger on mind and body.

Love you Adriene ❤️ watching this one day ahead (I just finished day 27!) and can’t wait to try! Looks like I’m going to finish the 30 days in a row this time! I’m not there yet on quite a lot of things but the confidence it gives me to just show up and try is wonderful (you see, I’m like the most inconsistent person ever). And I’ll tell you what, I CAN’T wait to start “Home” next! Thank you ❤️ and to all of those quarantine-yogis that are going to see this comment in the next days, keep it up, you’re doing amazing!!

Thanks for this can’t believe my wife and I have made this far whilst in lockdown in Edinburgh 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿 .We are feeling strong and fantastic. Congratulations to all that made it this far as 4M didn’t 👍😄
Having always had very poor upper body strength, I wasn't expecting to be able to do the flip dog, but I did it, yay! Felt great after this one!
Day 28 complete! I can really feel a difference in my upper body strength, I've been adding 10 push ups onto my yoga practice and before I couldn't even do 1! 😁 feeling good xx

Thanks Adriene. This has been a great focus for me during this weird world experience. Could you have ever imagined in 2015, that your videos would be helping someone in 2020, stuck at home during a global pandemic?

Hi there! Any advice ? I really can't stay so long in down dog, my arms are weak ^^ and my heels don't touch the floor. Staying on one leg is even worse, I can't stay in this pose more than 2 seconds ^^
I know this sounds strange but I find that when sitting I sit in a way that is more suited to my body instead of slouching, a small change that yoga has made for my body. Thank you!

How have we got to day 28 so quickly! 2 days to go and I’m already thinking of my next 30 days with ‘dedicate’. I love how I’m now adding my own moves in knowing what my body needs. I also knew I needed more today when the video ended so added on before relaxing. Thank you 🙏 x

Well my theals touched the floor today at downward dog, I gave up I thought it was not meant to happen in the first 30 days but it finally happened . SOOO HAPPYYY, I even did 5 push ups in a raw, I can't believe it, it's insane!!!  Thank you Adriene

I was so sure that I'd fall on my mat during the flipped dog pose so I just took a break to watch but then I realized I never skipped poses and always tried my best and even though I have very weak wrists I was able to hold the pose until the end and it was surprisingly comfortable and easy!! ^^
I got a yoga mat for my birthday today! Using it right now 💗

Well this destroyed me, but I have to say that I'm pretty satisfied with my flipped dog. In the last couple of years I noticed my wrists getting kind of weak but I feel that they are already doing so much better now, and only with a couple of weeks of yoga! 🥰
My arms were noodles in that pose haha! Thank you for today Adrienne! Today our moods totally synced up and I had a very fun yoga practice <3

DAY 28: Correction--- AWESOME Playful Yoga Practice--- :-)))) We love your philosophy about "No yoga robots!" It's such a refreshing concept.
You emphasize the "feeling" and the "fun" that yoga truly is. Hats, scarves, shawls, and wigs off to you, dear Adriene~!!!!! What a delightful "childhood inspired" session! Thank you . . . Namaste!!!! (With the  A in Namaste from Wisconsin) :-)

Day 28 done! I didn't attempt the flipped dog today as I knew that my improvised yoga mat (actually a roll-up camping mattress) would have had me slipping and sliding all over the place. My first purchase once lockdown is over will be a proper yoga mat! But I was quite proud of myself for not just sitting that whole movement out - instead I did a few plank push-ups, hovering cat cows and some other positions that I've learnt over the last month. Only 2 days left, but I've already got my next challenge lined up - the 31 day Revolution challenge. I can't wait!

I started today's practice with a very peaceful mind and as I got to the first downward dog, my heels finally touched the earth! I'm so thrilled right now that I just had to pause the video and share this experience :)
I was like a nimble fish 😊. I got energy. Kind of kicked in my way of practicing. Really playful yoga I liked very much.
02/04/2020: Mục tiêu sắp tới của mình sẽ là sức khoẻ tốt và học tập, nộp bài đúng hạn, sẽ thật chăm chỉ và cố gắng ạ. Namaste. Love.
Did day 28 with my 3 dogs in the room today which is normally a struggle but oh boy flipping the dog turned into an invitation for puppies to come under my bridge 😂😂

After nearly 5 years since I started YWA, these videos are still my go-to (although some days it takes me longer to decide on a video than the video itself😜). I try to hop on the mat daily and take some time for me, but don't always succeed, which I've learned is OKAY. I feel like Adriene has become a dear friend of mine, a confidant, someone I can be my true self with. For that, I am truly grateful.

"As we kind of peel off the old layers of paint..."

That one really moved me inside... It put in words how it does feel  for me. Going my own way, loving these yoga sessions, other processes in my life.

Like peeling off all the layers I put on myself, which gave me a look that wasn't even me. While peeling off, my true colors shine through again from behind the layers. First, it scared me to shits. Now, it feels good and it hits me that I got here. 
Happy tears role over my cheeks during this session.

 ❤ Thank you Adriene, for you being you. And for adding so much to my process in life. I send you my Love 🙏
No more back issues since using these videos for last year

Im no where near ready to this flip dog you did.. but thats ok.. I was in a really bad shape when I started. and even though I have this annoying cough I still went to the mat and did the rest. and this is a small victory... but now Im not sure whether to start again the 30 days or should I start another practice...

Me: *doing weird bridge pose* 
Hips: *pop*
Me: Adrienne didn't say they weren't supposed to so I guess I'm okay
Hips: *outside my body*
Me: I'm sure she has a pose later on to fix this
Thanks mam for today. Today is the kite festival in india. I just can't wait to go up and fly kites but yoga first 💓

This is the 3rd time this year 2019 that I have tried to complete the 30 days. Life kept throwing curve balls. I'm excited to have made it to day 28. Today being New Year's eve I am fully ready to finish up this 30 and start the next 30. I like how down to earth Adrien is and for being brand new to Yoga I find it prettt easy to follow along.

Day 28- Done! Today was particularly hard for me. I was mentally not in a good place and it greatly affected my practice. Paused a few times, went to child pose to rest but am glad that I completed it! It's so interesting to discover the mind-body connection of my own body!
Really enjoyed this playful practice 🙏🧘‍♀️
Two days to go!!

Thank you for the invitation to a new thirty days in a new year. I'm in! I've loved going through these thirty days, even though it's taken me more like 75 days. I've done many of the videos multiple times and some days I just do my own thing. But I'm really doing yoga everyday and it is an enormous benefit to me. Thank you, Adriene.
Every day is fun in different way, it is incredible :)

Ah! Those reminders! ❤️ "Remember to keep the child like wonder." Yes mam! 
Much love :')
"Ain't nothing good unless you play with it." ~George Clinton

Day 28 ✔️ Hi everyone! I hope you've been able to overcome the obstacles in your path to grow and continue on this yoga journey until today (hopefully beyond)! Today was another restorative day today, and not too long ago I was really frustrated with myself when I couldn't do the flow because I lost my balance or didn't have the strength or flexibility yet to do something. But it helped me to think of yoga as a long-term relationship; that you'll stick through the difficulties and keep showing up to put in the work no matter what, because you love yourself, what you do and those important to you. Being accountable for my own health has created a more empathetic individual, because whenever I need rest or feel frustration, I know it's because I'm doing my best to grow, rather than just complain about the world and being in a defensive and reactive state. Thank you for the continued encouragement teacher and friends 🙏🌞💜
Flip the dog? Well, that was a challenge!  🐶 But fun. Progress!
Love you adreine!!!

My husband started 30 days challenge after he saw what progress I made. He is on day 4th today. Patryk, if you read this on your 28th day ~ I ❤ U :) 

Thanks Adriene, you're the best! ABSOLUTLY WONDERFUL challenge :)
Thank you for this playful practice !!

I always come back to Yoga with Adriene! You don't hurry the pose or the exercise and your little reminders within each one enables so much more of the body to be included. Your voice is gentle and persuasive and encouraging to all levels participating! You push but you don't leave anyone behind! This is my go to for body and mind! Thank you!
I love you with all my heart that's my girl your dude and my buddy Benji my dog side by side till I die God bless Knocking on Heaven's Door❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤💍

My heels touched the floor in DFD!!! Thank-you Adriene, you've made me fall in love with yoga and it's doing so much for my mental health and flexibility. I appreciate so much how down-to-Earth you are. THANK-YOU
Day 28 and feeling great!! Good morning!!! Have an awesome day :) namaste and ty adriene xxx

i almost injured myself a little before 12:37 I have been doing all the days and am in shape.  I dont think your "warning" really read as a warning.  I was literally just trying the move nbd and I wasnt even trying to push myself but yeah it really feel like I almost snapped my arm and it was so fast and i feel like so scared

Can't believe that I'm done with Day 28! Today has been a long and tiring day. Got some deciding to do and it kinda stresses me out. Thankful for such relaxing practice and gentle reminder (to remember to have some fun). Thanks, Adriene! ♥♥♥ Namaste :)
Aaaaa!!! Day 28, finally my heels touch the matt in a down-facing doge pose! So excited and happy :)

I love how you don't take yourself so seriously! I get intimidated by a lot of the yoga tutorials on youtube thinking "I can't do that!" but you present the flows and poses in such a fun, non-intimidating way that I'm often amazed at what I'm capable of doing! Thanks!
I dedicate today's practice to little child me <3
Thank you, teacher.
My right heel touched the mat in downward dog today! Happy to even be halfway there :)
Another great practice Adriene! Thank you and keep doing these videos... Alvaro

I loved today's practice! It was a little bit challenging but great! That weird dog pose was hard! I fell a couple times but picked myself back up and rewinded the video a little and tried again! I don't know what I'm gonna do now that the 30 days are almost up! Give this a thumbs up if I should follow the monthly calender from the 8th of September! Doing these videos has been incredible and I don't want it to end! I will either start following the calender or another 30 days challenge. But most likely gonna follow the calender hehe ❤ much love and can't wait to continue this journey with all of you ❤❤
That was wonderful
Hi am having issues with yoga mats, they are willing and chunks are coming off of it??! I've been through 2 mats in like 20 days!! Is there any mat that you can recommend?
Thanks a lot 😘😘😍😍🥰🥰😍

Hey there yoga fam, I hope that everyone is having an amazing and blessed day. I also wanted to take a moment out of my day to thank Adriene for being the ish lol, best yoga teacher in the universe. It's about a month and a half for me now and thanks to you Adriene yoga has legit become part of my daily routine and tbh I feely crappy if it's not done. Ok so I was able to flip my dog for about 20 seconds! So awesome because at the beginning of August, I discovered I lost my back-bend, but it’s coming back! So is my balance and some flexibility and I can FEEL my circulation has much improved. I saw comments about not being able to touch heels to the floor in downward dog. I wouldn’t worry about it because during this short month, I’ve noticed one day I can’t do something, and the next day a newly developed skill pops up outta nowhere! For anyone starting a few years late like me 😏 keep going! Your heels will touch the ground soon. Namaste 🙏🏾

I cannot believe I flipped my downward-facing dog without falling.  And on day 27, I noticed that my tree pose has improved dramatically from earlier in the 30-day practice.  I posted your videos on my Facebook, and one of my friends responded by posting a picture of you and her together from when you came to a yoga retreat thing here in SoCal two years ago!  How funny is that??  And btw, this is the only program I've ever stuck with.  I always give up after a couple of weeks, but your practices are doable for me, and you change it up so it doesn't get boring.  I know it's weird to publically thank a stranger on a 2-year old video, but this has made my life better.  So thank you.
what  sweat! :) Good to be back after so long :)

I over exerted myself cleaning the house yesterday and have sore muscles esp. on my back and had been feeling feverish. I was planning on skipping this day but I recall doing the challenge one time when I had a headache and it was gone after the practice. So I soldiered through, even though I was groaning during the first few repetitions of sun salutation. At the end of the practice, I just felt so much better. The stretches actually soothed my tender muscles and I even did a few push ups at the end before going on corpse pose. What? This is magic, I tell ya.

Thank you so much Adriene!! I've been struggling to connect with myself (finished high school, about to enter college, feeling all kinds of crazy energy in my body and a racing mind) and this practice helped me remember to just BE MYSELF. To play, have fun and not worry about being or looking a certain way. I finally feel like I'm connecting back to who I am after months of confusion. Your practices have been a huge stabilizer and energy booster for me throughout this past year, and I'm sure for many others as well. Thank you for what you're doing. Love and peace and big goofy laughs, Maya. <3 <3
We are almost there

After the set of lunges, which are always a challenge for me, I paused the video and debated whether or not to continue. It's been a long, busy week with lots deep cleaning around the house. I woke up a little sore today, so maybe I should redo it tomorrow. Then, I thought maybe that was my mind talking and not my body. I decided to keep going... Not only did I finish today's practice, I managed to do the the reverse dogs on each side (not very gracefully, but I think a marvelous first attempt). I also didn't need anymore breaks because I was flooded with this wild, warm feeling of energy and strength. I'm so glad I didn't listen to my brain for once.

I held it for the whole time! I'm so thankful and full of wonder after this beautiful practice.
still loving it, even now :)

Hi Adriene. Just after Christmas I had serious pain in my back and I found your video for the lower back. I was so excited when 4 days after I started you began the 30 days of yoga. I'm doing yoga morning (before my 3 kids wake up) and at night (after they go to sleep) ....oh and in my dreams too ;) my mind is so much sharper at work and in general, and my body is toning up. Thank you for your quirkiness, the joy you bring, and the change you encourage. I'm telling everyone to get on the mat and change their lives... From Aotearoa, New Zealand
